"Housing First" Model: This model prioritizes providing people experiencing homelessness with permanent, affordable housing as quickly as possible. This approach has been shown to be effective in reducing homelessness and improving outcomes for those who have been homeless.

Community-Based Solutions: Community-based solutions involve working with local organizations and community members to identify and address the root causes of homelessness. This approach can include job training, mental health and substance abuse treatment, and other services tailored to the specific needs of the community.

Microhousing Units: Microhousing units are small, affordable housing units that can be built quickly and easily. These units can be used to provide temporary or permanent housing for people experiencing homelessness, and can be located in areas with high rental costs or limited affordable housing options.

Rapid Rehousing: Rapid rehousing involves providing people experiencing homelessness with short-term rental assistance and support services to help them quickly find and maintain permanent housing. This approach can be effective in helping people quickly exit homelessness and improve their long-term outcomes.

Housing Vouchers: Housing vouchers can be used to provide people experiencing homelessness with subsidized housing. These vouchers can be used to pay for a portion of the cost of rent in a variety of housing options, including apartments, single-family homes, and even hotels. This approach can be effective in providing people with the flexibility to choose the housing that best meets their needs.
